newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY UNION-CONNORS TO RETURN HOME.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-CONNORS TO RETURN HOME.

text.p: Australia are seeking further reinforcements to their squad after confirming their number eight Mark Connors will play no further part in their injury-hit tour of Europe.
Connors sustained medial ligament damage during Saturday's 37-19 win over a combined Edinburgh-Glasgow side, adding to Wallaby coach Greg Smith's availability problems.

Lock Garrick Morgan has already gone home with a broken ankle, flanker Michael Brial is another long-term casualty and centre Jason Little will be missing from next Saturday's test against Scotland at Murrayfield.
Flanker Brett Robinson and lock David Giffin are also suffering from hamstring problems, although uncapped centre Adam Magro and back-rower Owen Finegan have joined the party.
"We will try to get extra players over here," promised Smith, concerned he will have to field test players on Tuesday against the Combined Districts side at Perth.
"You could do that in days gone by, but the present is not linked to the past. Rugby is a professional game now, so we must protect our test players."
